meanings.definition: Situated above another part; higher in position.
meanings.sent1: The upper shelf held the books.
meanings.sent2: The upper bunk is where I sleep.
meanings.sent3: The upper clouds seemed to race each other across the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her upper hand in the game was clear to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The upper mountain peak was covered in snow.

meanings.definition: A part of a shoe or boot above the sole.
meanings.sent1: She tied the laces of her upper tightly.
meanings.sent2: The upper of the shoe was made of leather.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally stepped on his own upper.
meanings.sent4: The upper protected her feet from the cold.
meanings.sent5: The upper was scuffed from walking in the woods.

meanings.definition: A stimulant drug, especially an amphetamine.
meanings.sent1: He took an upper to stay awake during the night shift.
meanings.sent2: The doctor prescribed an upper for her fatigue.
meanings.sent3: The upper gave him a burst of energy.
meanings.sent4: She avoided taking uppers due to their side effects.
meanings.sent5: The upper increased his heart rate rapidly.
